tr.td: For these questions, please consider the most important things that you do, or wish to do, in your daily life. This might include having a job, managing your health and finances, spending time with family and friends, or participating in leisure - time activities. If you are not sure which response to choose, please make your best guess.

copyright.value: Used by permission of U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs, all rights reserved Creative Commons License

text.value: For these questions, please consider the most important things that you do, or wish to do, in your daily life. This might include having a job, managing your health and finances, spending time with family and friends, or participating in leisure - time activities. If you are not sure which response to choose, please make your best guess.
Which of the following is true for you and/or your immediate family over the PAST THREE MONTHS?
I always have enough food to eat.
I have access to stable housing that meets my needs.
I feel safe with the people in my home.
I can afford other basic expenses like healthcare, utilities, and clothing.
I have access to reliable transportation.
I have access to adequate health care.
I could benefit from legal assistance for a legal problem I am facing.
Please answer the following questions with regard to the PAST THREE MONTHS.
How often have you managed your money well, including for example, whether you are able to consistently: pay your bills on time, follow a budget, put extra money aside for the future.

How satisfied are you with your financial situation overall, including for example: your ability to pay for necessities, your ability to afford extras, the amount of savings and debt you have accumulated
